scale.4: Good - Strong capability with minor limitations
scale.2: Limited - Minimal capability or significant gaps
scale.1: Not available - Feature does not exist

fairnessStandards: Use specific, verifiable claims (not superlatives like 'best' or 'leading')
Provide context for ratings (why 5 vs. 4, why 2 vs. 1)
Include honest Upstream weaknesses where applicable
Focus on objective differences, not subjective superiority

comparisonCategories.name: Payer Intelligence & Monitoring
comparisonCategories.description: Core capability to detect and alert on payer behavior changes

dimensions.name: Early-Warning Detection
dimensions.description: Ability to detect payer behavior changes BEFORE claims are submitted

dimensions.name: Real-Time Alerts
dimensions.description: Alerts at the moment of claim submission or shortly after

dimensions.name: Behavioral Drift Tracking
dimensions.description: Longitudinal analysis of payer patterns over weeks/months

dimensions.name: Specialty-Specific Intelligence
dimensions.description: Custom rules for dialysis, ABA, imaging, home health (not general)

comparisonCategories.name: Denial Prevention Capabilities
comparisonCategories.description: Features that prevent denials before submission, not just recovery after

dimensions.name: Pre-Submission Warnings
dimensions.description: Alerts that fire before claims go out, allowing prevention

dimensions.name: Actionable Recommendations
dimensions.description: Specific guidance on how to adjust coding/documentation

dimensions.name: Edit Validation Integration
dimensions.description: Integration with claim scrubbing engines for edit checks

comparisonCategories.name: Implementation & Onboarding
comparisonCategories.description: Speed, complexity, and dependencies for going live

dimensions.name: Implementation Timeline
dimensions.description: Time from contract signing to go-live

dimensions.name: EHR Dependency
dimensions.description: Whether solution requires EHR vendor coordination and integration

dimensions.name: Setup Complexity
dimensions.description: Technical complexity and IT resources required

dimensions.name: Training Requirements
dimensions.description: Staff training time needed to use the system

comparisonCategories.name: Integrations & Connectivity
comparisonCategories.description: Depth of integration with EHR, PM, and clearinghouse systems

dimensions.name: EHR System Integration
dimensions.description: Direct integration with EHR platforms
dimensions.note: Adonis has deep EHR integrations; Upstream is EHR-independent by design

dimensions.name: Clearinghouse Integration
dimensions.description: Integration with major clearinghouses for claims data

dimensions.name: API Access
dimensions.description: APIs for custom integrations and data extraction

comparisonCategories.name: Support & Customer Success
comparisonCategories.description: Quality and availability of customer support, training, and success resources

dimensions.name: Implementation Support
dimensions.description: Dedicated resources during onboarding
dimensions.upstreamValue: Dedicated onboarding specialist for all customers

dimensions.name: Ongoing Support
dimensions.description: Support availability after go-live

dimensions.name: Specialty Billing Expertise
dimensions.description: Access to specialists in dialysis, ABA, imaging, home health

dimensions.name: Account Management
dimensions.description: Proactive account reviews and optimization

comparisonCategories.name: Pricing & Value
comparisonCategories.description: Pricing model, transparency, and total cost of ownership

dimensions.name: Pricing Model
dimensions.description: Fixed subscription vs. percentage-based

dimensions.name: Pricing Transparency
dimensions.description: Whether pricing is publicly disclosed and predictable

dimensions.name: Total Cost Predictability
dimensions.description: Ability to budget accurately for annual costs

useCaseMapping.description: Decision framework for when to choose each product

chooseUpstream: Imaging centers (prior auth pattern tracking critical)
Home health agencies (OASIS documentation tracking critical)
chooseCompetitor: General specialty practices (primary care, urgent care, general surgery)

chooseUpstream: Need to go live in 30-60 days
Cannot wait 3-6 months for EHR integration project
Limited IT resources for complex integrations
chooseCompetitor: No urgency - can wait 3-6 months for EHR integration
Strong preference for EHR-embedded solution (even if slower)
IT resources available for integration project

chooseUpstream: Want to prevent denials before submission (proactive)
Need early-warning signals (2-4 weeks advance notice)
Focus on behavioral drift detection (longitudinal analysis)
chooseCompetitor: Primarily focused on real-time alerts at submission
Prefer reactive alerts to proactive prevention
Already have strong scrubbing processes (need alerts for what gets through)

chooseUpstream: Need transparent fixed pricing for budgeting
Prefer subscription model over percentage of recovery
chooseCompetitor: ROI-based model aligns with internal approval processes
Willing to accept pricing opacity for EHR integration benefits

chooseUpstream: Do not need EHR-embedded solution (separate login acceptable)
Use unsupported EHR or custom PM system
chooseCompetitor: Must have EHR-embedded solution (no separate login)
Already on athenahealth, AdvancedMD, or eClinicalWorks
Staff resistant to separate tools outside EHR

competitorCost.notes: Percentage of recovery - varies with denial volume
competitorCost.assumptions: Assumes 10-15% of recovered denials, ~$200k-$300k annual recoveries

competitorCost.notes: Percentage of recovery - varies with denial volume
competitorCost.assumptions: Assumes 10-15% of recovered denials, ~$400k-$600k annual recoveries

competitorCost.notes: Percentage of recovery - varies with denial volume
competitorCost.assumptions: Assumes 10-15% of recovered denials, ~$600k-$1M annual recoveries

highConfidence: Dialysis, ABA, imaging, or home health specialty
Frustrated with EHR integration delays from previous vendors
mediumConfidence: General specialty but interested in prevention vs. recovery
Small practice (under 10 providers) needing simple deployment
lowConfidence: Already deeply integrated with athenahealth/AdvancedMD/eCW and satisfied
Strong preference for EHR-embedded solution (will not use separate tool)
General specialty practice with no interest in specialty-specific intelligence
Enterprise organization requiring extensive vendor vetting (Upstream too new)
